forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 59. South wind around 6 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Cloudy then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers after 1pm. Cloudy. High near 74, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. South wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the early morning, Boston cradles itself in a gentle shroud of cloud cover, the air damp and the horizon softened by mist. The temperature hovers around a mild sixty degrees, as a light south wind stirs through the streets. There’s a quiet promise of rain, though only a whisper of what may come later in the day, with the atmosphere heavy but expectant. As the hours move toward mid-afternoon, the clouds will linger persistently, with a modest chance of showers making their presence felt, a slight interruption to the day’s rhythm. 

Despite the muted hues of the morning, the warmth may hold a certain comfort; dressing in layers—perhaps a light jacket or a cozy sweater—will be wise as temperatures shift gently throughout the day. It is a fine time to wander through the lesser-known corners of the city, perhaps the vibrant heart of a local café or the tranquil aisles of a bookshop, where the dampness outside won’t matter as you savor a warm drink and lose yourself in an engrossing story. A tranquil walk along the Charles River, with the city’s lights reflecting softly upon the water, could offer solace and clarity. Embrace the day not as dreary but rich with potential, where every drop of rain holds the promise of renewal.
